answers.answer: Medical services for pregnant women are managed on different levels: Primary medical assistance, Specialized ambulatory medical assistance for paraclinical specialties, and Specialized ambulatory medical assistance for clinical specialties.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Under primary medical assistance, monitoring includes supervision in the first quarter, monthly monitoring from the 3rd to 7th month, and twice a month monitoring from the 7th to 9th month, along with post-maternity and post-birth baby monitoring at home.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Primary medical assistance'.

answers.answer: The basic package includes Papanicolau cervico-vaginal cytological examination, examinations of vaginal secretions (native and colored microscopic for bacterial and fungal identification), Antibiogram, and Antifungigram.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Specialized ambulatory medical assistance for paraclinical specialties'.

answers.answer: Mandatory services include obstetrics-gynecology specialist consultations, complete blood count, ABO and Rh blood group determination, various serum tests (urea, uric acid, creatinine, glucose, TGP, TGO, TSH), complete urine examination, VDRL or RPR, HIV testing, evaluation for specific infections (rubella, toxoplasmosis, CMV, hepatitis B and C), vaginal discharge, and specific tests like Pap test, Glucose Tolerance Test, Fetal Biometry, or Group B Streptococcus Detection, along with confirmation ultrasound and pregnancy viability.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Specialized ambulatory medical assistance for clinical specialties'.

answers.answer: Prenatal screening is typically performed between S11 and S19+6 days of pregnancy and includes an obstetrics-gynecology specialist consultation (for integrative interpretation of results), a Double test/triple test, and an ultrasound to detect fetal anomalies.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Prenatal screening (S11 - S19 + 6 days)'.

answers.answer: High-risk pregnancy conditions covered include gestational oedema, mild hyperemesis gravidarum, and evaluation of pregnant women with scarred uterus in the third trimester. Mandatory services vary by condition but generally involve obstetrics-gynecology specialist consultations, blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, serum creatinine, TGP, TGO), urine tests (e.g., complete urine examination, protein dosage), and obstetric and gynecological ultrasound.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Surveillance of other high-risk pregnancies'.

answers.answer: Health units providing normal pregnancy supervision must have an obstetrics-gynecology office with specialist consultation, ultrasound, and a medical analysis laboratory. For diagnostic cases of normal pregnancy supervision and prenatal screening, services are contracted with obstetrics-gynecology specialty hospitals and other health units with beds that have obstetrics-gynecology and neonatology departments ranked at level 1, 2, or 3.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Specialized ambulatory medical assistance for clinical specialties'.

answers.answer: High-risk pregnancy monitoring in pregnant women with coagulation disorders or hereditary and acquired thrombophilias is included in the basic package of hospital medical care.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Amniocentesis, cordocentesis, and chorionic villus biopsy services are covered during day hospitalization. Chorionic villus biopsy is covered for pregnant women in the first trimester, and amniocentesis and cordocentesis for those in the second trimester, performed by specialized doctors for specific indications like major anomalies or genetic pathology risks.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Day hospitalization medical services can transition to continuous hospitalization if the patient experiences complications or comorbidities with risk, major bleeding requiring volume repletion, anesthetic risk difficult to manage in day hospitalization, or difficult-to-control post-procedural pain, especially with associated major invasive procedures.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The Women's Center provides support for accessing reproductive health services, including contraception, breastfeeding, prevention of sexually transmitted diseases, pregnancy monitoring, and abortion, as well as assistance in navigating the health system and services for victims of domestic violence.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/pregnant-women-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Women's Center'.
